meanings.definition: A type of stitch made by a sewing machine in which the top thread interlocks with the bobbin thread.
meanings.sent1: The tailor used a lockstitched seam to secure the hem of the dress.
meanings.sent2: The lockstitched pattern on the fabric was neat and durable.
meanings.sent3: The lockstitched design on the pillowcase kept the feathers from escaping.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a lockstitched bond, holding their friendship together.
meanings.sent5: The lockstitched detail added a touch of elegance to the curtains.

meanings.sent1: She lockstitched the edges of the fabric to prevent fraying.
meanings.sent2: The tailor lockstitched the seams of the jacket for a professional finish.
meanings.sent3: He lockstitched the torn teddy bear back together with care.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was lockstitched through shared experiences.
meanings.sent5: The community lockstitched blankets for those in need during the winter.
